comments.body:
Why do we iterate over whole list to just remove first detected datatype? We should either assume that those types are heterogeneous or not (all elements have same type).

My understanding is that golang types are hererogenius so we can assume that checking first element should be enough.
The issue is that the first value might have the secret cleared out (see the IsZero calls in the struct case)
Also, if it's declared as a slice of interface type, we can't be sure that the first element's concrete type is representative of the collection as a whole.

The `reflect` package can be very panicky.  Consider adding a `recover` to this entry-point as a defensive measure against developer error.

Ideally, that would be linked to some metric that would provide enough information for us to correct any possible oversight, but metric / api changes are probably beyond the scope for this PR.  Maybe just logging a warning for now?
Ack, will do that and leave a todo.
